fields.description:
*Assessment*

When uploading a network.json to the cloud property 'cloud.network.network_configuration' to configure Edge networking, there should be a check to confirm if the "Name" variable under the "Clusters" element matches a registered cluster. 

For example, the following cluster has the name 'Mastermind':
{code}
# euca-describe-availability-zones
AVAILABILITYZONE	Mastermind	10.104.10.11 arn:euca:eucalyptus:Mastermind:cluster:ThugCry/
{code}

When the network.json was uploaded, it reported no errors:
{code}
[root@odc-c-11 ~]# euca-modify-property -f cloud.network.network_configuration=/root/network.json
PROPERTY	cloud.network.network_configuration	{
    "InstanceDnsDomain": "eucalyptus.internal",
    "InstanceDnsServers": ["10.1.1.254", "8.8.8.8"],
    "PublicIps": [
        "10.104.6.230-10.104.6.255"
    ],
    "Subnets": [
    ],
    "Clusters": [
        {
            "Name": "LoveLockdown",
            "MacPrefix": "d0:0d",
            "Subnet": {
                "Name": "172.18.0.0",
                "Subnet": "172.18.0.0",
                "Netmask": "255.255.0.0",
                "Gateway": "172.18.0.1"
            },
            "PrivateIps": [
                "172.18.0.100-172.18.0.200"
            ]
        }
    ]
} was {}
{code}

However, when trying to launch an instance, the following would be seen:
{code}
# euca-run-instances -k euca-admin -g test-group -t m1.xlarge emi-c2ac9be6
euca-run-instances: error (InsufficientInstanceCapacity): Insufficient addresses
{code}

If the name of the cluster doesn't match a registered cluster, we should report an error when uploading the json to the 'cloud.network.network_configuration' cloud property.  This would help with providing a better user experience.

*Signs*

* euca-describe-addresses verbose output:
{code}
# euca-describe-addresses verbose
ADDRESS	10.104.6.230	nobody	standard
ADDRESS	10.104.6.231	nobody	standard
ADDRESS	10.104.6.232	nobody	standard
ADDRESS	10.104.6.233	nobody	standard
ADDRESS	10.104.6.234	nobody	standard
ADDRESS	10.104.6.235	nobody	standard
ADDRESS	10.104.6.236	nobody	standard
ADDRESS	10.104.6.237	nobody	standard
ADDRESS	10.104.6.238	nobody	standard
ADDRESS	10.104.6.239	nobody	standard
ADDRESS	10.104.6.240	nobody	standard
ADDRESS	10.104.6.241	nobody	standard
ADDRESS	10.104.6.242	nobody	standard
ADDRESS	10.104.6.243	nobody	standard
ADDRESS	10.104.6.244	nobody	standard
ADDRESS	10.104.6.245	nobody	standard
ADDRESS	10.104.6.246	nobody	standard
ADDRESS	10.104.6.247	nobody	standard
ADDRESS	10.104.6.248	nobody	standard
ADDRESS	10.104.6.249	nobody	standard
ADDRESS	10.104.6.250	nobody	standard
ADDRESS	10.104.6.251	nobody	standard
ADDRESS	10.104.6.252	nobody	standard
ADDRESS	10.104.6.253	nobody	standard
ADDRESS	10.104.6.254	nobody	standard
ADDRESS	10.104.6.255	nobody	standard
{code}
* availability-zone verbose
{code}
# euca-describe-availability-zones verbose
AVAILABILITYZONE	Mastermind	10.104.10.11 arn:euca:eucalyptus:Mastermind:cluster:ThugCry/
AVAILABILITYZONE	|- vm types	free / max   cpu   ram  disk
AVAILABILITYZONE	|- m1.small	0006 / 0006   1    256     5
AVAILABILITYZONE	|- t1.micro	0006 / 0006   1    256     5
AVAILABILITYZONE	|- m1.medium	0006 / 0006   1    512    10
AVAILABILITYZONE	|- c1.medium	0003 / 0003   2    512    10
AVAILABILITYZONE	|- m1.large	0003 / 0003   2    512    10
AVAILABILITYZONE	|- m1.xlarge	0003 / 0003   2   1024    10
AVAILABILITYZONE	|- c1.xlarge	0003 / 0003   2   2048    10
AVAILABILITYZONE	|- m2.xlarge	0003 / 0003   2   2048    10
AVAILABILITYZONE	|- m3.xlarge	0001 / 0001   4   2048    15
AVAILABILITYZONE	|- m2.2xlarge	0001 / 0001   2   4096    30
AVAILABILITYZONE	|- m3.2xlarge	0001 / 0001   4   4096    30
AVAILABILITYZONE	|- cc1.4xlarge	0000 / 0000   8   3072    60
AVAILABILITYZONE	|- m2.4xlarge	0000 / 0000   8   4096    60
AVAILABILITYZONE	|- hi1.4xlarge	0000 / 0000   8   6144   120
AVAILABILITYZONE	|- cc2.8xlarge	0000 / 0000  16   6144   120
AVAILABILITYZONE	|- cg1.4xlarge	0000 / 0000  16   12288   200
AVAILABILITYZONE	|- cr1.8xlarge	0000 / 0000  16   16384   240
AVAILABILITYZONE	|- hs1.8xlarge	0000 / 0000  48   119808  24000
{code}
* cloud properties associated with networking:
{code}
# euca-describe-properties | grep network | grep -v network_configuration
PROPERTY	Mastermind.cluster.addressespernetwork	-1
PROPERTY	Mastermind.cluster.maxnetworkindex	-1
PROPERTY	Mastermind.cluster.maxnetworktag	-1
PROPERTY	Mastermind.cluster.minnetworkindex	-1
PROPERTY	Mastermind.cluster.minnetworktag	-1
PROPERTY	Mastermind.cluster.networkmode	EDGE
PROPERTY	Mastermind.cluster.usenetworktags	false
PROPERTY	cloud.network.global_max_network_index	4096
PROPERTY	cloud.network.global_max_network_tag	4096
PROPERTY	cloud.network.global_min_network_index	2
PROPERTY	cloud.network.global_min_network_tag	1
PROPERTY	cloud.network.min_broadcast_interval	5
PROPERTY	cloud.network.network_index_pending_timeout	35
PROPERTY	cloud.network.network_tag_pending_timeout	35
PROPERTY	cloud.vmstate.network_metadata_refresh_time	15
{code}

*Workaround/Solution*

Once the proper cluster name was updated in the network.json file, the instance launched successfully.
{code}
[root@odc-c-11 ~]# euca-modify-property -f cloud.network.network_configuration=/root/network.json
PROPERTY	cloud.network.network_configuration	{
    "InstanceDnsDomain": "eucalyptus.internal",
    "InstanceDnsServers": ["10.1.1.254", "8.8.8.8"],
    "PublicIps": [
        "10.104.6.230-10.104.6.255"
    ],
    "Subnets": [
    ],
    "Clusters": [
        {
            "Name": "Mastermind",
            "MacPrefix": "d0:0d",
            "Subnet": {
                "Name": "172.18.0.0",
                "Subnet": "172.18.0.0",
                "Netmask": "255.255.0.0",
                "Gateway": "172.18.0.1"
            },
            "PrivateIps": [
                "172.18.0.100-172.18.0.200"
            ]
        }
    ]
} was {
    "InstanceDnsDomain": "eucalyptus.internal",
    "InstanceDnsServers": ["10.1.1.254", "8.8.8.8"],
    "PublicIps": [
        "10.104.6.230-10.104.6.255"
    ],
    "Subnets": [
    ],
    "Clusters": [
        {
            "Name": "LoveLockdown",
            "MacPrefix": "d0:0d",
            "Subnet": {
                "Name": "172.18.0.0",
                "Subnet": "172.18.0.0",
                "Netmask": "255.255.0.0",
                "Gateway": "172.18.0.1"
            },
            "PrivateIps": [
                "172.18.0.100-172.18.0.200"
            ]
        }
    ]
}
[root@odc-c-11 ~]# euca-run-instances -k euca-admin -g test-group -t m1.xlarge emi-c2ac9be6
RESERVATION	r-01008bde	244437812323	test-group
INSTANCE	i-52479927	emi-c2ac9be6	172.18.0.106	172.18.0.106	pending	euca-admin	0		m1.xlarge	2014-04-08T22:46:31.840Z	Mastermind				monitoring-disabled	172.18.0.106	172.18.0.106			instance-store					hvm			sg-102499ec
{code}
fields.summary: Starting/running an instance in a cluster without a valid network configuration should fail with a clear error.

comments.body: The cluster name is not checked by design as this allows you to set the network configuration in advance of registering clusters if desired.

Hey [~sjones], 

Ah ok.  So should the network JSON be uploaded before registering the cluster?  Should there be any sanity checks when the cluster(s) are registered?
This is a major usability issue and has been hit by many of our internal users.

[~smarvin], [~neil] we should likely have cluster naming not needed by default (which [~sjones] is resolving now) and then have an "if you're doing multi-cluster" section to set the network.json config up correctly.
Good to know re: cluster name. Can we maybe get a better error message or something?
Starting / running an instance in a cluster that is not configured should result in a more useful error.

Fix Verified

Installed Packages
Name        : eucalyptus
Arch        : x86_64
Version     : 4.0.0
Release     : 0.0.922.20140424git344494aa.el6

I removed one cluster from network configuration json for my multicluster setup and see the clear error
{code}
[root@h-20 ~]# euca-run-instances emi-0c579109
euca-run-instances: error (InsufficientInstanceCapacity): Networking configuration not found for cluster 'PARTI01'
{code}
